column2: LETTER TO THE EDITORS Intense immunosuppression for the treatment of an immune reconstitution inﬂammatory syndrome-like exacerbation after natalizumab withdrawal: a case report

column1: A real world multi center study on efficacy and safety of natalizumab in Indian patients with multiple sclerosis_Author links open overlay panel_Thomas Mathew a_, _Vikram Kamath b_, _Saji K John a_, _M Netravat.pdf
column2: A real world multi center study on efficacy and safety of natalizumab in Indian patients with multiple sclerosis

It meets the population criterion (adults, as patients were ≥18 years old) and intervention criterion (focuses on natalizumab, with no inclusion/exclusion of other interventions like ocrelizumab or fingolimod). Outcomes related to MS (relapse rate, EDSS score, PML) are reported, fulfilling the outcomes criterion.

column1: Butzkueven et al. - Similar clinical outcomes for natalizumab patients switching to every-6-week dosing versus remaining.pdf

column1: Clerico et al. - Extending the Interval of Natalizumab Dosing Is Efficacy Preserved.pdf
